verses.text: Wine \add is\add* a mocker , strong drink \add is\add* raging : and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.
The fear of a king \add is\add* as the roaring of a lion : \add whoso\add* provoketh him to anger sinneth \add against\add* his own soul.
\add It is\add* an honour for a man to cease from strife : but every fool will be meddling.
The sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold ; \add therefore\add* shall he beg in harvest , and \add have\add* nothing.\f + \fr 20.4 \ft cold: or, winter\f*
Counsel in the heart of man \add is like\add* deep water ; but a man of understanding will draw it out.
Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness : but a faithful man who can find ?\f + \fr 20.6 \ft goodness: or, bounty\f*
The just \add man\add* walketh in his integrity : his children \add are\add* blessed after him.
A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.
Who can say , I have made my heart clean , I am pure from my sin ?

Divers weights , \add and\add* divers measures , both of them \add are\add* alike abomination to the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 20.10 \ft Divers weights: Heb. A stone and a stone\f*\f + \fr 20.10 \ft divers measures: Heb. an ephah and an ephah\f*
Even a child is known by his doings , whether his work \add be\add* pure , and whether \add it be\add* right.
The hearing ear , and the seeing eye , the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath made even both of them.
Love not sleep , lest thou come to poverty ; open thine eyes , \add and\add* thou shalt be satisfied with bread.
\add It is\add* naught , \add it is\add* naught , saith the buyer : but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.
There is gold , and a multitude of rubies : but the lips of knowledge \add are\add* a precious jewel.
Take his garment that is surety \add for\add* a stranger : and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.
Bread of deceit \add is\add* sweet to a man ; but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.\f + \fr 20.17 \ft deceit: Heb. lying, or, falsehood\f*
\add Every\add* purpose is established by counsel : and with good advice make war.
He that goeth about \add as\add* a talebearer revealeth secrets : therefore meddle not with him that flattereth with his lips.\f + \fr 20.19 \ft flattereth: or, enticeth\f*
Whoso curseth his father or his mother , his lamp shall be put out in obscure darkness.\f + \fr 20.20 \ft lamp: or, candle\f*
An inheritance \add may be\add* gotten hastily at the beginning ; but the end thereof shall not be blessed.
Say not thou, I will recompense evil ; \add but\add* wait on the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and he shall save thee.
Divers weights \add are\add* an abomination unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; and a false balance \add is\add* not good.\f + \fr 20.23 \ft a false…: Heb. balance of deceit\f*
Man’s goings \add are\add* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; how can a man then understand his own way ?
\add It is\add* a snare to the man \add who\add* devoureth \add that which is\add* holy , and after vows to make enquiry.
A wise king scattereth the wicked , and bringeth the wheel over them.
The spirit of man \add is\add* the candle of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, searching all the inward parts of the belly.\f + \fr 20.27 \ft candle: or, lamp\f*
Mercy and truth preserve the king : and his throne is upholden by mercy.
The glory of young men \add is\add* their strength : and the beauty of old men \add is\add* the gray head.
The blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil : so \add do\add* stripes the inward parts of the belly.\f + \fr 20.30 \ft cleanseth…: Heb. is a purging medicine against\f*
